title: Show All History and Manage History: Library window does not show any history
content:
When I try to see my history using the History -> Show All History menu-item or Hamburger -> History -> Manage History menu-item, Firefox displays a Library window without any history. My Settings' History "Firefox will" has been set to "Remember History" for many years. I shut down my laptop and turned on my laptop and saw the same behavior.

I would have attached to this message a screenshot that shows the Library window, but could not because when uploading my screenshot, the Uploaded images' area showed a rotating circle that kept rotating for at least ten minutes and I got tired of it wasting my valuable time. The image's size is 63 KB. I tried uploading using Firefox and Chrome and both showed the same behavior.
creator: rxyicefirefa

title: Will no longer open up more than one tab when starting a new browser.
content: Since as long as I can remember, Firefox in SETTING has us to open more than ONE Tab when opening a new Window. We used to be able in setting enter as many URLs as we wanted on a NEW browser. Can't seem to new open up three TABS
creator: jagman55

title: Firefox authentication code says "password incorrect" when signing in.
content:
I am trying to sign in on Firefox after I signed out. I input my email and password, and get told that Firefox has sent a code to my email. I enter the code, but then get told "Incorrect Password". However, I know the password is correct, since it sent me the email code and if I do put in an incorrect password, it does not do that. It does not say that the code was wrong.

In addition, since I have two email addresses associated with my account, it requires me to put in my primary address, but then changes it to my other address (which is the one I made the account with).

I tried doing a fresh install of Firefox, but it does not seem to have helped.

This is very frustrating, because I had to make an entirely new account to post this, since I could not sign in to my normal account.
creator: pmsinclair+firefoxbackup

title: numbers
content: How do I change it back to numbers, in purple on pictureÂ ?
creator: hayjude777

title: Browser can't display certain HTML coding
content:
On certain website searches, i.e. (Google search: browse from Search window, "foxnation") certain words with the HTML tag "text string " will not display the text. If I employ the Inspect feature and edit this code, i.e., remove it then the text is displayed. I also searched the "em" tag from the Google search engine and the same problem is displayed.

I using Firefox 95.0.2 on a MacPro running Mojave.

I have tried editing the about:config setting for the sandbox.content from the default "3" down to "0" without success.

Any ideas would be helpful. For now, it's back to Safari.
creator: tkauffman

title: Copy-Paste Images from Firefox to Discord causes duplicated images
content:
I use Firefox a lot, and a couple of months ago, it started duplicating images whenever I ctrl-v'd the images into discord. Since then, I've completely reinstalled firefox several times, with no addons-I also tried the beta and nightly versions, and even Waterfox, and still run into this problem. It seems to be an issue that strikes a lot of firefox users, and I haven't been able to find a fix yet.

In short: copy image paste image into discord (it doesn't matter if it's ctrl-v or right click paste) two images are attached to the message instead of one

This only happens to some images, mainly .pngs. I have no idea what is causing this problem and I would appreciate some kind of fix.
creator: DHH

title: Does not load any web pages
content: Brand new pc, new download of Firefox. App opens and allows web addresses to be entered but does not load anything. Nothing happens, it's a blank page. I can't access any settings pages either. I've downloaded and reinstalled Firefox a few times and I got an error message during installation two of the times. I've attached a screenshot of the error message, which reads "firefox.exe - System Error // The code execution cannot proceed because VCRUNTIME140_1.dll was not found. Reinstalling the program may fix this problem."
creator: tiredpianist

title: Can't load Facebook in regular window- only private window
content: Hi there- I can't open Facebook in a regular window; I have to use a private window. How can I go back to opening it in a regular window?
creator: aaronbrace

title: Content frames not displaying on certain websites.
content:
My Firefox (95.0.2 and many previous) seems to be having issues displaying content on some sites. It isn't on all websites and is consistent with the ones affected. www.penny-arcade.com is one of the afflicted sites. Paragraphs of text just do not appear and I run minimal plugins/addons. Pages run correctly in Troubleshoot mode. Pages also are correct in other browsers.

Things I have tried: Refresh FF Reinstall FF (nuking reg entries and scouring installation folders after uninstall) Turn off/uninstall All plugins/addons Enable/Disable HTTPS only Turn on/off Hardware Acceleration Standard/Strict/Custom Security & Privacy settings Some True to False option in about:config about mixed content (I can't seem to remember what...)

I have tried to resolve this on my own. For the life of me I can't seem to figure out why.
creator: samuelwatters
